commit 43520d8fe8347fd6fb96e011e51521a72620876c
Author: LongChang Ma <chad.ma@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Fri Aug 7 16:02:31 2020 +0800

    [components]: ota: optimize ota process
    
    1.reset slot flag before upgrade the slot.
    
    2.set the active flag after the slot fw boot successfully.
    
    3.When slot 0 switch to slot 1, we will check slot 1 success_boot and
     try_remaining flag, if all these are 0, don't do switch.
    
     When slot 1 switch to slot 0, we will check slot 0 success_boot and
     try_remaining flag, if all these are 0, reboot to maskrom device.
    
    Signed-off-by: LongChang Ma <chad.ma@rock-chips.com>
    Change-Id: I218f1df4f521f4afc8fd4a953386ea0c1f17192c

commit 440aef58b07f6b4873f35899bbd0b37ade3eef66
Author: Chris Zhong <zyw@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Fri Jul 24 17:51:11 2020 +0800

    Image: rk2108: update loader
    
    The rk2108_loader.bin would check the validity of the firmware, and try
    to boot OSA 3 times, if all 3 boot fail, it will boot OSB instead. So
    the startup application must set the successful_boot to 1, let loader
    know that this firmware can be successfully boot on.
    
    This patch Force enable RT_USING_FWANALYS, so that the startup
    application can call fw_slot_set_active to set successful_boot flag.
    
    In addition, we can also modify the byte with offset address 0x0C of the
    rk2108_loader.bin to 0 to turn off this feature. In this way, the system
    will always boot from OSA.
    
    And the Byte wifh offset 08 is the config of debug uart, bit0 is switch
    of debug print, bit[4-7] is uart port number, bit[1-3] is mux number of
    uart. For example, 0x13 means enable uart1_mux1 for debug port, the log
    of loader would output to uart1_mux1. If modify it to 0x11, means the
    debug port is uart1_mux0.
    
    Signed-off-by: Chris Zhong <zyw@rock-chips.com>
    Change-Id: Ie2c0adc8e70df7a5a146e3d3fffb989a92866779

commit d864976b48de7f83902d48c180592e3314bb8782
Author: LongChang Ma <chad.ma@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 28 15:30:08 2020 +0800

    [dsp_fw]: add get dsp fw version from rkdsp_fw file.
    
    Signed-off-by: LongChang Ma <chad.ma@rock-chips.com>
    Change-Id: I0587f1d2fe792ebc8ad2242daec5afa47df7af19

    [BSP]: rockchip: rk816 rtc: add alarm support

    Change-Id: I3073ea91c863a0a3fe9dbbfaadc8478c3af99da8

commit af31b07d2705f5f4913ae395994785c53010a0a3
Author: Joseph Chen <chenjh@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 22 11:25:34 2020 +0800

    [components]: RTC: optimise alarm
    
    The Most RTC is often to support year, month and day setting,
    but current alarm.c only support assign hour, minute and second.
    
    What's worse, it treats out of date alarm as the next day alarm
    which means the alarm driver must maintain the relationship on
    year-month-day change.
    
    Let's optimise:
    - Increase stack size to avoid stack overflow;
    - Add year-month-day setting support;
    - Disable creating out of date alarm;
    - Add simple alarm get/set command;
    - Auto init alarm system;
    
    Alarm command:
        msh />alarm
        No alarm
        msh />alarm 2018 04 01 12 30 30
        msh />alarm 2018 04 01 12 30 40
        msh />alarm 2018 04 01 12 30 50
        msh />alarm
        Alarm list:
        	  Sun Apr  1 12:30:50 2018
        	  Sun Apr  1 12:30:40 2018
        	* Sun Apr  1 12:30:30 2018
        msh />
    
    Signed-off-by: Joseph Chen <chenjh@rock-chips.com>
    Change-Id: I9bf34219c1c3c0b09c668bc46f0fcb042963c65b

commit 05cec3979a39679c6b52babb4c79ec05e0f6e1d5

commit f3bc3f4c91cf7688b113703c6447eaeb9d0f4374
Author: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 8 16:31:36 2020 +0800

    [BSP]: rockchip: common: usbd: add pm support
    
    This patch register rk_usbd_pm_ops to suspend and resume
    usb phy and controller for usbd if it doesn't support usb
    vbus detection to dynamically control usb power consumption.
    
    And this patch also remove usb controller lower level init
    from usb_pcd_init() if usb support vbus detection, and it
    dynamically init the usb controller and phy after battery
    charger detection complete. This can help to save 3ms during
    system boot.
    
    Change-Id: Id3d65a7ab45af844e5d18fcbe6e7de5f09a00946
    Signed-off-by: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>

Date:   Tue Jun 30 18:03:23 2020 +0800

    [components]: usbdevice: msc: fix msc unrecognized on Mac OS
    
    This patch fix the device descriptor of msc, set the field
    of bDeviceClass, bDeviceSubClass, bDeviceProtocol to zero,
    so the interface within the configuration specifies its own
    class information and protocol.
    
    With this patch, the usb msc can be recognized on Mac OS.

commit 86d4123ce5ade3a27ac0302cbeec1ff696e10e35
Author: Chris Zhong <zyw@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Tue May 19 17:21:39 2020 +0800

    [components]: usbdevice: uac: Increase period_size to 10ms
    
    For some codec (such as es8156), start and stop functions take time to
    do i2c communication, and uac thread will frequently call start and
    stop, the extra time will cause xrun, it is safe to increase
    period_size.
    
    Signed-off-by: Chris Zhong <zyw@rock-chips.com>
    Change-Id: I965e570a88bd8ac07a82d2f9c7558b5f56533183

    [BSP]: rockchip: common: pl330: Stop only when it has been started
    
    The pl330_stop would power off the audio_pd, ensure the balance of
    start and stop, do not stop it too many times.
    
    Signed-off-by: Chris Zhong <zyw@rock-chips.com>

commit ee50ae7d12c9ff9079ae428c3321298f5850ef7c
Author: Jair Wu <jair.wu@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Fri May 8 11:09:48 2020 +0800

    [BSP]: Rockchip: Separate rkdsp_fw from drv_dsp
    
    If define dsp_fw[] as static and be included
    by drv_dsp.c will cause drv_dsp.o too large,
    and drv_dsp.o is link to SRAM which will
    cause heap less.
    If dsp_fw[] is 300K, heap size will decrease
    300k.
    
    Signed-off-by: Jair Wu <jair.wu@rock-chips.com>
    Change-Id: I869bc6f65a8f164ef0970742096c1b0e9e657594

commit 6797134c20c3b92e1f524e470143aee86e55a66a
Author: Xing Zheng <zhengxing@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 3 11:09:41 2020 +0800

    [BSP]: rockchip: common: audio: support audio pcm plugins framework
    
    This patch add pcm plugin in audio driver layer. It
    is similar to the basic plugins of Linux ALSA pcm.
    
    There are some products, we need to use softvol plugin.
    For example, the hardware codec does not have an i2c
    interface, and can only adjust the software volume.
    And configure plugin easily through config files.
    
    Thus, it looks like this:
    user player --> softvol plugin --> hardware plugin --> HW devices.
    
    According to this architecture, we can add other plugins
    (e.g. route/dmix/dshare) and even customize the ext plugins.
    
    Change-Id: Ice51112409f96deb21ad66cab23bb439c6b14062
    Signed-off-by: Xing Zheng <zhengxing@rock-chips.com>

commit 0c8b3bf11f78aa0fed028b0bed57b43b1f48702f
Author: Shawn Lin <shawn.lin@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 16 14:45:41 2020 +0800

    UPSTREAM: component: sdio: fix potential ricky clock setting
    
    Currently RTT mmc stack only support Highspeed mode or
    blow, which means the max speed should be 52MHz according
    to JEDEC spec. Two problems show here:
    
    (1) max_data_rate = (unsigned int)-1. The value of unsigned int
    depends on compilers/arch. Moreover, it makes no sense to assume
    cpu addressing width with IP clock rate limit.
    (1)hs_max_data_rate was set to 200MHz.
    
    So what should BSP drivers do if 52MHz < max_data_rate < 200MHz?
    Either it blindly sets a spec-violated clock rate to drive a Highspeed
    card, or just adjust the clock rate internally. Both cases are
    really bad for practice.
    
    If the card claims to support Highspeed, we set the clock to not
    to exceed 52MHz. Otherwise it should be set according to
    card->max_data_rate parsed by ext_csd. This patch fixes it as-is,
    and also simplify the code a lot.
    
    Change-Id: Iafecb12a82eb3b3abd8f3d35eca2ccbad3397aaf
    Signed-off-by: Shawn Lin <shawn.lin@rock-chips.com>
    (cherry picked from 4c7106fa9d5871c6402c9a4f336504c9f1f78b60)

commit 75f101e6f3a6965b2119e1ab23f1231b7dd1b74b
Author: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Mon Jan 13 19:26:26 2020 +0800

    rockchip-common: usbd: support bcd and phy suspend
    
    This patch supports battery charging detect. Genericly，
    we can use gpio or phy bvalid signal to detect the vbus
    voltage, and then start bcd process if the vbus voltage
    is in high level. This patch only implements gpio method
    on rk2108 platforms for the time being.
    
    And this patch also supports usb phy enter normal/suspend
    mode dynamically and usb clocks management for power
    optimization at runtime.
    
    Signed-off-by: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>
    Change-Id: Ib044973242ee76459a1cfad61cb88fdcbb53d097

commit b9b4f90f80663ca16157af6b8a669544fc0f963c
Author: Cliff Chen <cliff.chen@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 2 19:23:55 2020 +0800

commit 738ebd5f77561b79e290eeff3798b8e39bee0bb5
Author: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 2 09:01:28 2020 +0800

    [components]: usbdevice: msc: improve performance for msc
    
    This msc device driver read/write a block for block device
    at a time. For nor flash, the size of a block is 4096 bytes.
    For emmc, the size of a block is only 512 bytes. It's unable
    to run the best performance if read/write a block at a time.
    
    This patch adds a new config RT_USB_MSTORAGE_BUFLEN to set the
    buffer size in each reading/writing for the block device. And
    the default size is 4096 bytes. It also sets the size of usb
    req the same as the value to get better IO transaction on usb
    bus.
    
    It must be noted that, this default value of RT_USB_MSTORAGE_BUFLEN
    was decided experimentally as a trade-off between memory and
    performance.
    
    I have tested the performance of msc on RK2108 EVB and RK2108
    recording pen board with ATTO Disk tool.
    
    1. Without this patch
       - RK2108 EVB with nor flash
         read:  ~ 100 KBps
         write: ~ 921 6KBps
    
       - RK2108 recording pen board with FORSEE-NCEMAD9D-16G emmc
         read:  ~ 740 KBps
         write: ~ 1650 KBps
    
    2. With this patch
       - RK2108 EVB with nor flash
         read:  ~ 130 KBps
         write: ~ 15400 KBps
    
       - RK2108 recording pen board with FORSEE-NCEMAD9D-16G emmc
         read:  ~ 3938 KBps
         write: ~ 3847 KBps
    
    Change-Id: If37108578d9178d661fd7da5ba95fd7f7c101f96
    Signed-off-by: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>

commit 73b9d0dfee4ed02342da5f9355645bbb46253224
Author: Jair Wu <jair.wu@rock-chips.com>

commit ca588292c4b75733cbc2d7c4199985b5015448ab
Author: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 12 09:59:52 2019 +0800

    rockchip-common: usbd: move g_ep_pool to board.c
    
    The g_ep_pool is used to configure the properties of
    all the endponits which the USB controller can support.
    And their types and maxpackets can be reconfigured on
    different boards, so we move the g_ep_pool to board.c
    
    Note that the status of the struct ep_id maybe set
    dynamicly in usb core, so we can't use type const
    for the g_ep_pool.
    
    Change-Id: Ic30c2e4953c364e7bf1f02338cea834b2f2b583a
    Signed-off-by: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>

commit 9ee78a5339d878c4da0fb34f349fe7c4d5007e05
Author: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Thu Oct 31 16:28:36 2019 +0800

    [components]: usbdevice: core: handle data immediately for UAC1
    
    UAC1 uses isochronous transfer which is continuous and real-time
    in creation, delivery, and consumption. So it needs to handle
    data in irq handler, rather than send msg and wait for usb device
    thread to process the msg.
    
    Change-Id: I67484f4d1d97e13839432be102295af720f8dc8e
    Signed-off-by: William Wu <william.wu@rock-chips.com>

    [BSP] KOALA: add firmware for koala
    
    the address of DTCM in firmware is 0x30200000 ~ 0x3023ffff,

commit 49264513426f758e13d78de087f4e95e5f2002ba
Author: Liao Huaping <huaping.liao@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 28 20:34:55 2019 +0800

    rockchip-common: dsp: Access tcm data use rk_dsp_tcm_memcpy
    
    Dsp itcm need access by word, dtcm can access by byte.
    If use rt_memcpy function to access itcm, maybe access by byte,
    will access fail. So use rk_dsp_tcm_memcpy function to loader
    firmware.
    
    Change-Id: I5867b65146905a83c43060d86e9460c43d098ae5
    Signed-off-by: Liao Huaping <huaping.liao@rock-chips.com>

commit b419021c328a3bcd4f8762536f1895abaf87ba4e
Author: Jianqun Xu <jay.xu@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 21 10:51:40 2019 +0800

    [BSP] common: tests: modify 'tgpio' to be generic
    
    'tgpio' help
    
    tgpio 0|1|2|3 <value>
    tgpio a|b|c|d|e|f|g|h|i|j|k
    tgpio t|x
        0 <value>  Set GPIO0 test pins, example GPIO0_PIN_A1 tgpio 0 0x00000002
        1 <value>  Set GPIO1 test pins, example GPIO1_PIN_A1 tgpio 1 0x00000002
        2 <value>  Set GPIO2 test pins, example GPIO2_PIN_A1 tgpio 2 0x00000002
        3 <value>  Set GPIO3 test pins, example GPIO3_PIN_A1 tgpio 3 0x00000002
        a input, pull normal
        b input, pull up
        c input, pull down
        d output high, io drive strength level 0
        e output low , io drive strength level 0
        f output high, io drive strength level 1
        g output low , io drive strength level 1
        h output high, io drive strength level 2
        i output low , io drive strength level 2
        j output high, io drive strength level 3
        k output low , io drive strength level 3
    
    Examples for RK2108:
        tgpio 0 0xffff03ff   Select GPIO0 pins except GPIO_PIN_B2,GPIO_PIN_B3,GPIO_PIN_B4,GPIO_PIN_B5,GPIO_PIN_B6,GPIO_PIN_B7
        tgpio 1 0xfffffff0   Select GPIO1 pins except GPIO_PIN_A0,GPIO_PIN_A1,GPIO_PIN_A2,GPIO_PIN_A3
        tgpio a              TestCase: input, pull normal
        tgpio t              Start thread to check pins level change
        tgpio x              Exit from check pins thread
    
    Change-Id: I1f58d15d50394f9bbfd4845c97f191410741b5a0
    Signed-off-by: Jianqun Xu <jay.xu@rock-chips.com>

commit 1d7956a75c244e02b2184f2fb85e949f34319ad1
Author: Andy Yan <andy.yan@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 14 10:57:43 2019 +0800

    [BSP]: rockchip-koala: Remove section type COPY for heap section
    
    According to The GNU linker[0], 3.6.8.1 Output Section Type:
    When a section type set as COPY, the section should be marked
    as not allocatable, so that no memory is allocated for the section.
    
    It seems the next section follow it will overlap with it.
    
    [0]https://www.eecs.umich.edu/courses/eecs373/readings/Linker.pdf
    
    Change-Id: Id1af31d7f3871e2fdefc286334e6454f5dcbd974
    Signed-off-by: Andy Yan <andy.yan@rock-chips.com>

commit 270d91c5183bd8d0fe399eea9c78db5ceceefbd9
Author: Liao Huaping <huaping.liao@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Fri Aug 2 19:41:31 2019 +0800

    [BSP]: rockchip-common: dsp: Use a ringbuf for word queue
    
    If interrupt continue happen from same chan, there will use
    same work address for "rt_workqueue_dowork", the function will
    return -RT_EBUSY, so the interrupt callback will lose current
    eventi, so need use ringbuf to avoid the problem.
    
    Change-Id: I59eaccead875d57db2e95354f4b2557a0a33222a
    Signed-off-by: Liao Huaping <huaping.liao@rock-chips.com>

commit 189717c33fdfe6862d06705401247325cd3070a0
Author: Nickey Yang <nickey.yang@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 5 11:23:05 2019 +0800

    rockchip-common: dsi: get final dsi mbps in HAL_DSI_M31DphyInit
    
    PLL frequency division in M31 dphy can not be divided into all frequencies.
    In order to make the timing configuration of DSI host the same as dphy,
    get the final mbps in the driver by HAL_DSI_M31DphyInit return value.
    
    Change-Id: I3d01fdcebd62968ce0bad4149cd1c5f787c408fa
    Signed-off-by: Nickey Yang <nickey.yang@rock-chips.com>

commit f33a4d1a5cd69417d6dd468b6ab6eecc47def56e
Author: Andy Yan <andy.yan@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 25 16:09:37 2019 +0800

    [BSP]: rockchip-koala: Remove eh_frame_hdr section
    
    The .eh_frame_hdr section contains additional information
    about the .eh_frame section. A pointer to the start of the
    .eh_frame data, and optionally, a binary search table of
    pointers to the .eh_frame records are found in this section.
    
    Data in this section is encoded according to the DWARF Exception
    Header Encoding described below.
    
    We don't use it.
    
    Change-Id: I0d0e9b7cc58890a5616cbbb04bf24fca1510d982
    Signed-off-by: Andy Yan <andy.yan@rock-chips.com>

commit 52bd3b5e8ce4b8a4c0ad5be3abfc1fc8cbffd7b3
Author: Andy Yan <andy.yan@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Tue Jun 25 14:38:22 2019 +0800

    [BSP]: rockchip-koala: Enable CMBACKTRACE
    
    CmBacktrace is short for Cortex-M backtrace, which
    can be used to trap, locate, debug errors such as Hard
    Fault, Memory Management Fault, Bus Fault, Usage Fault,
    Debug Fault.
    
    For more detial information [0].
    
    [0]: https://github.com/armink/CmBacktrace
    
    Change-Id: Ib7ad9c5014455cd3a3d149510522b67943f090aa
    Signed-off-by: Andy Yan <andy.yan@rock-chips.com>

Date:   Mon May 27 15:40:19 2019 +0800

    [BSP] rockchip-common: use general interrupt APIs from rthw.h
    
    To use general interrupt APIs, need to include rthw.h
        rt_hw_interrupt_install - register irq handler
        rt_hw_interrupt_umask - enable irq
        rt_hw_interrupt_mask - disable irq
    
    The rthw.h hasn't API to set irq priority, that need to do in HAL.
    
    Change-Id: I379ac4b98a68fa2aa072f9e0901f8b459369cfc6

commit 0361e7ec2b2b50c11716e5ab07677f37433405a3
Author: Jianqun Xu <jay.xu@rock-chips.com>
Date:   Thu May 30 11:58:03 2019 +0800

    [BSP] rockchip-common: update gpio driver
    
    This patch update the rockchip common gpio driver, move GPIO infomation
    to bsp.c which under hal files.
    
    The GPIO driver can be used as follows:
     (A) The GPIO PIN APIs provide by pin component:
           1) rt_pin_read - get pin level;
           2) rt_pin_write- set pin level;
           3) rt_pin_mode - set pin input/output with pull up/down/od;
     (B) The GPIO IRQ APIs provide by pin component:
           1) pin_attach_irq;
           2) pin_detach_irq;
           3) pin_irq_enable;
    
    Notes:
     (A) User MUST to provide GPIO information by HAL_GPIO_Probe firstly.
     (B) When call HAL_GPIO_Init, do remember that the GPIO_Pin is actually
           1 << pin, and can support several pins once time.
           It's useful for driver to set IOs onetime, such as sdmmc driver to set
           SDMMC_D0/D1/D2/D3 to pullup.
     (E) The GPIO_VER_ID only defined from RK2108 SoCs, driver may needs to
           update when new version GPIO is designed.
    
    Change-Id: I26dcc5ce5b1fe09ba56395788ec72bc3d5a9ba3c
    Signed-off-by: Jianqun Xu <jay.xu@rock-chips.com>

commit d3764db892e4e97b6d599bda867eaa49b0ad4786
Author: liruncong <liruncong2018@qq.com>
Date:   Tue Oct 23 20:03:18 2018 +0800

    解决以下问题:
    1) usb驱动中时间未与RT_TICK_PER_SECOND关联问题,RT_TICK_PER_SECOND变化时,这些时间将发生变化
    解决: 增加USB_TIMEOUT_BASIC/USB_TIMEOUT_LONG/USB_DEBOUNCE_TIME
    2) 修正rt_usbh_detach_instance函数使用device->cfg_desc前未判断是否有效. 可导致abort
    3) rt_usbh_hub_port_change增加device->port初始化,否则struct uhcd_ops相关函数无法直接得到端口号

commit fe055dc3994be268d552fa9b82b99e88e0cac3d9
Merge: ee1e316 472ca31
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Oct 6 18:28:18 2018 +0800

    Merge pull request #1867 from xuzhuoyi/libc
    
    [libc] Remove redefinition in minilibc/errno.h

commit 86742879f3631e2fb995291877f9bdb98e4a0107
Author: SASANO Takayoshi <uaa@uaa.org.uk>
Date:   Sat Oct 6 18:33:18 2018 +0900

    There is no problem to create hello.mo with default compiler on
    Debian-9.5/amd64.
    
    But building hello.mo with i386-elf-gcc (5.5.0) cross compiler on
    OpenBSD-6.3/amd64, undefined reference to 'rt_kprintf' error occurs.
    
    To avoid this error, "compile and link" process needs to be divided to
    simply "compile" and "link".
    
    On Debian-9.5, both previous and current method produces same hello.mo.
    
    We have to improve disk image creation (Linux dependent),
    this is a future homework.

Date:   Wed Oct 3 23:08:17 2018 +0800

    Merge pull request #1861 from jg1uaa/master
    
    avoid to conflicting types for 'uint32_t' error.

commit 54f23a42939a2775385e18acb0eea7aa6e37c511
Author: SASANO Takayoshi <uaa@uaa.org.uk>
Date:   Wed Oct 3 21:03:00 2018 +0900

    avoid to conflicting types for 'uint32_t' error.
    already uint32_t is defined at components/libc/compilers/minilibc/stdint.h.
    
    there is two ways to solve, using <stdint.h>/uint32_t pair or
    <rtthread.h>/rt_uint32_t pair.
    
    I choose former because this code belongs to C compiler, not RT-Thread system.

commit af1044955ac67fc22a7813e492559ab1fe297028
Author: liruncong <liruncong2018@qq.com>
Date:   Sat Sep 15 11:37:14 2018 +0800

    修正am335x中mmu问题
    1) mmu_disable_dcache/mmu_enable_dcache等, 应使用rt_cpu_xxx相关函数,否则会跑飞. armcc并没有提供rt_cpu_xxx对应汇编代码,先删除
    2) mmu_setmtt抽取为函数mmu_setmtts,并增加RT_WEAK.mmu_setmtts此处作为示例函数.实际用户板子可在bsp中重新实现该函数.可在rt_components_board_init函数前调用rt_hw_mmu_init

commit d450f541421f0380f85d39f4244f79fa6076514c
Merge: 666d39c 99cbadc
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jun 4 19:28:53 2018 +0800

    Merge pull request #1501 from TanekLiang/hifive1-fixed-led
    
    [bsp][hifive1] remove unused code

commit ed75173cac1a76982f344227ecf39fd3d5eef4de
Author: zheng-chow <sernia.zhou@foxmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jun 4 18:14:59 2018 +0800

    Fix the SD Card and EMAC issue:
    1. The issue concerns sdmmc library bug (I finally solved) in SD_Init() in the file sdmmc/src/fsl_sd.c:SD_SelectBusTiming()
    calls SD_SwitchFunction() which sets block size to 64bytes (512bits).Therefore SD_SetBlockSize(card, FSL_SDMMC_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE)
    should be called again before SD_Init() exits.
    2. The issue is wrong variable in drv_emac.c:lpc_emac_tx(), and the wrong data length of send packet
    to cause the send failure.
    
    Signed-off-by: zheng-chow <sernia.zhou@foxmail.com>

    解决get_week的有效值与IS_RTC_WEEKDAY判断有效值不一致的问题。
    get_week获取的值是0-6.而stm32f4xx_rtc.h中IS_RTC_WEEKDAY中判断的有效值是1-7.当设置日期是周日时，会有问题。

    修复以下问题:

    2.  修复ft5406驱动挂载i2c总线到i2c1 bus。

    1. 移除rtgui相关初始化代码.。
    2. 导出lcd相关配置参数：HSW/HFP/HBP/VSW/VFP/VBP/Backlight pin/Reset pin/width pixel/height pixel。

Author: liuguang <1004383796@qq.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 19 21:32:32 2018 +0800

    [BSP] fix pin drive bug and add interrupt mode. | 修复PIN驱动BUG并添加中断模式.
    
    更新如下:
    1. 修复GPIO5_0~2管脚复用调用错误(错误情况会影响SDRAM正常工作)。
    2. 添加中断模式，支持上升沿、下降沿、双边沿、高电平、低电平触发中断模式。
    3. 移除C99特性。

    [BSP][STM32F4xx-HAL]Update clock tree
    
    修正84M主频下48M时钟的产生错误
    修正没有对部分芯片需要单独配置48M时源(RCC_PERIPHCLK_CLK48)
    增加芯片存在非通用时钟树配置时产生编译警告
    严正警告。F4工作在100M主频下(F411等)无法正确产生48M时钟,此时请另行配置时钟或降频至84M使用。自动配置的时钟将导致芯片无法启动。（只要是不能产生48M时钟的HCLK配置均不能使用该BSP内的自动时钟配置，芯片最大主频中只有100M无法使用）

commit 813919b6756cc000ae3459b1f4385eeceb7b6d38
Merge: ea60877 eade1bb
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Dec 28 14:17:59 2017 +0800

Merge: 2ac4936 19448a9

Date:   Mon Aug 28 13:12:19 2017 +0800

    [bsp] fix the serial output issue because GPIO_Configuration in stm32f40x.

commit 19448a920cef9c867b6f72393c742b4f98e2fede
Author: mqb <mengqingbin5219@163.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 28 12:39:17 2017 +0800

    修改了GPIO_Configuration
    
    STM32F4系列UART在初始化的时候，如果GPIO_AF放到GPIO_INIT后边，系统复位后，串口会向外发送一个字节的数据，通常是0x00。将GPIO_AF放到GPIO_INIT前边可以避开这个问题。

commit 0fc0ed1bb1880014eb81073d3810c88a5e6acd92

commit 54395808339868877f5d401a46ed8885fbbe74a1
Author: He Chunhui <hchunhui@mail.ustc.edu.cn>
Date:   Wed Mar 16 07:43:38 2016 +0000

    fix incompatible unit in LWIP_NAT_TMR_INTERVAL_SEC
    
    LWIP_NAT_TMR_INTERVAL_SEC defined in ipv4_nat.h is in miliseconds,
    but ip_nat_check_timeout() thinks it's in seconds.
    
    With this bug, all nat entries will expire immediately when
    ip_nat_check_timeout() is called.
    
    Note sys_timeout() is in miliseconds.

commit e0998e3c230a16fa1a60ff14fa52590bcce16eda
Merge: 10fd3d3 aee3a1d
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 8 14:35:24 2016 +0800

    Merge pull request #614 from onelife/upstream
    
    SCons PreProcessor patch: Stop processing "#define" in false condition

commit aee3a1d4c51d0becfab37863696cf217ea054cd8
Author: onelife <onelife.real@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 8 01:38:05 2016 +0800

    SCons PreProcessor patch: Stop processing "#define" in false condition
    
    Example "rtconfig.h" content:
     ...
     //#define BOARD_USING_LED
     #if defined(BOARD_USING_LED)
     #define RT_USING_RTGUI
     #endif
     ...
    
    - Before patching, RTGUI module will be built although not intend to do so.
    - After patching, RTGUI module will not be built.

    修正mkdir lseek中文件句柄不释放的bug

commit 0da4930cc90b4f474bf73eb281daac05d4245b71
Merge: 342e8d6 b886340
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Sep 11 09:04:03 2015 +0800

    Merge pull request #548 from GalaIO/master
    
    [Kernel] change to open the console device and then set the console device.

commit b886340e67df395261a4b863f65bf7c136d8c239
Author: GalaIO <GalaIO@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 10 22:59:51 2015 +0800

    open and then get the new device
    
    in rt_console_set_device, open new device first and get the new device to _console_device.
    我在编写程序时，在device驱动中打印log，但是使用rt_kprintf时，如果_console_device存在非空，那就执行驱动的write函数，但是这是device还没有初始化成功，但是已经提前给_console_device赋值，导致了程序无故fault，以上述修改可避开这样的矛盾。

Merge: 9fa2a04 4222677

    [libcpu][am335x] Fix the booting failure when enabling MMU

commit 42226779338716fbef7ab4eab6386fe3462912ae
Author: Adrian Huang <adrianhuang0701@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon May 11 09:57:12 2015 +0800

    [libcpu][am335x] Fix the booting failure when enabling MMU
    
    Since the 16 domains are configured as the client domains in
    mmu_setttbase(), a Permission fault is generated if the XN bit
    (Execute-never) is set in the short-descriptor translation table
    (for section and supersection). This leads to the booting failure
    when enabling MMU for beagleboard bsp. Here is log:
    
    ----------------------------------------------------------------
    SD/MMC found on device 0
    reading uEnv.txt
    117 bytes read in 3 ms (38.1 KiB/s)
    Loaded environment from uEnv.txt
    Importing environment from mmc ...
    Running uenvcmd ...
    reading rtthread.bin
    162624 bytes read in 24 ms (6.5 MiB/s)
    \## Starting application at 0x80200000 ...
    
    ----------------------------------------------------------------
    
    This commit removes the XN bit configuration in the section of the
    short-descriptor translation table. The OS can be booted successfully
    with applying this commit.

commit 7e260dbcce375152eaa52d3be5f1f8465943bd5d
Author: www220@tom.com <www220@tom.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 8 00:52:42 2015 +0800

    修正rtt-root位于其他目录时计算目录错误的bug

commit ced7d5a34fca3a910497ab472290e357fb48df85
Author: ItsEddy <itseddy0402@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 7 20:37:59 2015 +0800

    [DeviceDriver] stm32: Remove explicity clear of RXNE flag
    
    According to STM32 Manual, the USART RXNE flag will be clear automatically after
    read to the USART_DR register[1], so the call to USART_ClearITPendingBit is
    unnecessary.
    
    [1]: See RM0090 Reference Manual p.992, Bit 5

Merge: 89ceb7d a61d228
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 11 00:02:02 2015 +0800

    Merge pull request #432 from bright-pan/master
    
    Port Nanopb[zlib license] for protocal encode/decode

commit a61d228b764baa422ad39dc14f91e80f225369df
Author: Bright Pan <bright_pan@163.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 10 18:07:33 2015 +0800

    Nanopb is a plain-C implementation of Google's Protocol Buffers data
    format. It is targeted at 32 bit microcontrollers, but is also fit for
    other embedded systems with tight (2-10 kB ROM, <1 kB RAM) memory
    constraints.(http://koti.kapsi.fi/jpa/nanopb/)
    
    How to use the example:
    	1. move examples/nanopb to bsp/xxxx/
    	2. enable macro RT_USING_NANOPB in rtconfig.h
    	3. regenerate the project file (scons --target=xxxx)
    	4. rebuild the project

commit 1daa96a214d0fd2c85fc339f47de7d14899afd8f
Author: ardafu <pengfei.fu@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 10 12:13:14 2015 +0800

    1. [BSP] TM4C129x : Fix the bug that enable global INT before OS scheduler start the fist thread.
    2. [BSP] TM4C129x : According to LunchPad, change device id from TM4C1294XCNZAD   to TM4C1294NCPDT

Author: Bright Pan <bright_pan@163.com>

     [Driver/ringbuffer]: Fix put_force bug
        OXape reports: http://www.rt-thread.org/phpBB3/topic3939.html
              driver/ringbuffer: when data length is bigger than space length
              for rb, the read_index in rb is not update.
        When length > space, update the read_index, the bug can be fix, and
              works fine.

commit 01ab0c1d1ef31fc7f36d518661e4141c0eaf4c5f
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 22 17:22:01 2015 +0800

    crt_init: fix hardfault in Keil toolchain when there is no cpp object
    
    If there is no SHT$$INIT_ARRAY, calling
    $Super$$__cpp_initialize__aeabi_() will fault. At least until Keil5.12
    the problem still exists. So we have to initialize the C++ runtime our
    own.

commit 11026d05791d7208036b18c043d6e968ef366f00
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jan 7 12:50:43 2015 +0800

    lpc43xx: clean the .o before building M0 and M4
    
    SCons will omit the file in parent dir of SConstruct somehow and build
    the object files in that dir instead of in variant dir. This cause
    problem because we cannot mix the object files between M0 and M4 which
    SCons failed to rebuild. So we have to manually remove the files before
    building.

commit 090adcf4c070083e98fce673dcb23c5a97c5bd00
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jan 5 21:32:21 2015 +0800

    lpc43xx: don't set the Clock again in M0 core
    
    M0 core is always booted by the M4 core. It means that if we are running
    in M0, the clock is always configured.

Merge: 188b642 d479960
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 28 05:12:12 2014 +0800

    Merge pull request #401 from grissiom/fix-ymodem
    
    ymodem: fix a race-condition in handshaking

commit d479960aac7f8c10f50343b017e924cdbb5d22f9
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 26 22:20:17 2014 +0800

    ymodem: fix a race-condition in handshaking
    
    As we are sending C continuously, there is a chance that the
    sender(remote) receive an C after sending the first handshake package.
    So the sender will interpret it as NAK and re-send the package. So we
    just ignore it and proceed.

          File "/home/xxx/src/SConstruct", line 39:
            objs = PrepareBuilding(env, RTT_ROOT, has_libcpu=True)
          ...
          File "/home/xxx/src/drivers/SConscript", line 12:
            SrcRemove(src, src_need_remove)
          File "/home/rt-thread-stable/tools/building.py", line 496:
            if type(src[0]) == type('str'):

commit a1beec4ad3976367905b9f5f8bb1309a0dae42b8
Author: Xiongfei Guo <xfguo@credosemi.com>
Date:   Sat Sep 6 14:33:46 2014 +0800

    Remove unsupport syntex for python 2.6.
    
    Dict Comprehensions is imported in Python 2.7 & 3.0 which is PEP 274 [1]. Some
    OS like CentOS 6 which is use Python 2.6 cannot support this syntex.
    
    [1] http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/
    
    Signed-off-by: Xiongfei Guo <xfguo@credosemi.com>

commit ddd51caf62299b11e1a8826a0a67149a39142e64
Merge: be9aa36 d413399
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 3 17:17:30 2014 +0800

    Merge pull request #336 from grissiom/fix-idle
    
    kernel/idle: fix rt_thread_idle_excute in high optimization level

commit d4133990b0736fb6b845d80ffe002f8e70881e9e
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 2 17:21:31 2014 +0800

    kernel/idle: fix rt_thread_idle_excute in high optimization level
    
    The rt_list_isempty has prototype of "int rt_list_isempty(const rt_list_t *l)".
    So the compiler has a good reason that the rt_thread_defunct list does
    not change within rt_thread_idle_excute thus optimize the "while" loop
    into a "if".
    
    So add the volatile qualifier when test against the rt_thread_defunc list.

commit ab729429b31757ca19f81a8a35ef7018afa048d3
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 1 10:41:37 2014 +0800

    minilibc: define SIZE_MAX in stdint.h

commit 51c4a3aeaea9947701e03abd085afc3eb07df6a8
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 28 12:27:47 2014 +0800

    tools/building: remove the use of startupinfo
    
    The startupinfo does not have any visible effects on the building
    process and some old Python version does not have it at all. So remove
    it for the seek of simple.
    
    Tested `scons -j4` in a dual core virtual machine.

    tools/keil: preserve the order of CPPPATH
    
    The order of CPPPATH is important: some project would use the order of
    CPPPATH to override the default configuration headers. This commit also
    refine the this piece of code in a more Pythonic way.

commit be0c0481e966e4013f4017678ac2b8958b3b77cc
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 20 10:24:41 2014 +0800

    workqueue: fix the windows eol

commit b8bf6bef76bdabe76749c752217afbe5d24ba371
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 20 10:16:04 2014 +0800

    kernel: mempool: fix race condition in rt_mp_alloc
    
    When thread wake up from waiting for memory, there is a chance that
    there is no memory available in high pressure. So use a loop to check
    again. Otherwise, there will be a NULL reference.

commit 66ac9821de92f0015ba070b4285e8df1fa822bb6
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat May 24 13:04:49 2014 +0800

    Scons: fix the Win32Spawn
    
    Windows(tm) CreateProcess does not use the env passed to it to find the
    executables. So we have to modify our own PATH to make Popen work. Also,
    detect the cmd build-in commands and execute it directly.
    
    Tested on MDK toolchain on RB4088 and the MSVS toolchain on simulator
    BSP.

Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 16 10:47:30 2014 +0800

    [mempool] reset the thread->error before suspending thread
    
    Time out result and other errors is recorded in thread->error. Dirty
    error will screw up the error handling code after the thread has been
    wake up.

commit 299cccfb2655423de544db00ed09485df212b3c7
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 10 21:18:38 2014 +0800

    logtrace: add log_session_lvl
    
    log_session_lvl is suitable for performance critical places where in
    most cases, the log is turned off by level. If the session is const and
    the level is greater than session->lvl, the whole function will be
    optimized out.

commit 12728bcdff4c983215c6ac26f1bbdd2e9512f64b
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>

    Compiler may do more optimization when the parameter is const.

Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 10 16:34:32 2014 +0800

    Merge pull request #254 from weety/Branch_usb
    
    [USB]fix rt_usbd_set_config() BUG which set the USB device to configurat...

commit 81b284b316c27e8c39e8a1deabbeef31a13612bc
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 10 15:09:20 2014 +0800

    scons: no need to set RTT_ROOT as Repository
    
    In SCons manual:
    
    =================
    In order to inform the C compiler about the repositories,  SCons will
    add appropriate -I flags to the compilation commands for each directory
    in the $CPPPATH list. So if we add the current directory to the
    construction environment $CPPPATH like so:
    
        env = Environment(CPPPATH = ['.'])
        env.Program('hello.c')
        Repository('/usr/repository1')
    
    Then re-executing SCons yields:
    
        % scons -Q
        cc -o hello.o -c -I. -I/usr/repository1 hello.c
        cc -o hello hello.o
    =================
    
    The additional include directory is definitely not what we want. Just
    remove the additional Repository line.

commit a03816ef9aa583bb16ad1282dacaad9c02b87cd7
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 10 15:03:11 2014 +0800

    scons: seperate the BSP build with the kernel build
    
    BSPs could have their own components/ etc. If they point to the same
    folder, SCons would find the wrong source code to compile.

Merge: de16b80 c44f32e

    Msh next

commit c44f32e513569858e95f1aa4e9ab531b8577e398
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Mar 27 16:15:56 2014 +0800

    [msh] cd to path when possible
    
    When DFS_USING_WORKDIR is enabled, msh will try to chdir if the command
    is not found. For example, if there is folder named "SD", and there is
    no `SD` command and `SD.mo` module, typing "SD" in msh will cd to the
    folder.
    
    In more detail, the execution order right now is:
    
    1. built-in command
    2. module
    3. cd to path
    
    If you have a folder named "ps", you have to run `cd ps` to change the
    working dir.

commit f9659283c0f357bc9559181ca303fecc6801c5e0
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Mar 27 15:09:53 2014 +0800

    [msh] try to complete module path
    
    Msh can execute module directly. So try to auto-complete the path when
    user press TAB. There is a chance that the path is a module.

commit 04f432f47b906e129209daf8e505ac0f6b57ebd0
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Dec 21 11:31:40 2013 +0800

    kernel: let rt_thread_idle_excute loop until there is no dead thread
    
    Out side world is difficult to tell whethere there is dead thread
    remaining. If rt_thread_idle_excute only do one cleanup, it's hard to
    finish cleanups outside the idle thread. So let is loop and do all the
    cleanups in one call.

commit 408ac34bc2d762db7019a14cc5caf8af4df57b43
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Dec 21 11:24:37 2013 +0800

    kernel: add rt_critical_level that return the lock count of scheduler
    
    Out side world may be interested in whether the scheduler is locked or
    not. Provide an API to tell that.

commit e9e8e3f3cafbbd1287e4226b93b9ad5d40f211e3
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 18 20:52:55 2013 +0800

    TC: do not use rt_sem_trytake to clean the sem
    
    There can be a race condition that the sem has alread been detached
    after we did the cleanup. Besides, there is a RT_IPC_CMD_RESET command
    in rt_sem_control which is more clear in setting the sem values.

commit a8520ed383e9557993d647f477ecb4d6658c3ccd
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Nov 17 12:13:25 2013 +0800

    cortex-r4: let svc mode reuse the stack of IRQ on startup
    
    As the svc stack is the stack of threads, there is no need to allocate a
    separate stack for the startup. Reuse the IRQ stack should be OK.
    
    Tested on rm48 board.

        SYSCLK_Frequency is 48000000HZ

        do components intialization.

        initialize finsh_system_init:0 done
        finsh>>

Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Oct 25 20:31:02 2013 +0800

    serial: set the errno if and only if in thread context
    
    The errno is associated with threads. It will crash the thread if we set
    it in interrupt context.

Merge: ac5da68 377c6e6

Date:   Tue Oct 22 16:22:02 2013 -0700

    Rm48x50 next

commit a391e0a89307258b54e2599368963ce95fa7e7d3
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 23 01:48:47 2013 +0800

    log_trace: add a in-mem-log example
    
    After `log_trace_init()`, call `memlog_init`. It then turn the logtrace
    into a "in-memory" logger which will buffer all the log in memory. It
    also set a hook in idle to flush all the log into console. One may
    create an other thread to flush the logs but idle might be the simplest
    place to go.

commit 2a9e893c79f4ede3e893059551e415e1597312df
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 21 00:31:10 2013 +0800

    initialize timer in bsp
    
    With new timer algorithm, timer should be initialized during startup. So
    add them to the bsps. Use these commands to get which bsp is missing
    calling the function:
    
        % git grep rt_system_timer_init bsp|sed -n 's|bsp/\([^/]*\).*|\1|p' | sort | uniq > have_tm_init
        % ls -1 bsp |sed -n 's|\([^/]*\).*|\1|p' | sort > all_bsp
        % comm -3 all_bsp have_tm_init
        beaglebone
        lpc176x
        lpc178x
        ls1bdev
        mb9bf506r
        stm32f10x
        xplorer4330

commit 5641360b4970de3afebe759117194556de6d2218
Author: prife <goprife@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Oct 1 17:43:38 2013 +0800

    simulator: add createdef.py to generate def file for VS
    
    Now we can get rid off Mingw to create def file. To create def file, one
    should run:
    
        scons --def
    
    in the bsp/simulator.

commit b72001fcac18d2c37c24e423cc7e15fe900dc172
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 14 09:50:18 2013 +0800

    kernel: mutex could only be released in thread context
    
    Mutex has the idea of ownership, only the thread which owns the mutex
    can release it. So rt_mutex_release could only be called in thread
    context.  Add a debug guard to it.

commit d59aa279c37b7aba07385a3a2cb3057bce6c5fea
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 26 15:52:02 2013 +0800

    kernel: use skip list to implement timer list
    
    Skip list is a "random" data structure that in high possibilities it
    would get O(log(N)) time complexity in inserting while the old list get
    O(N). Forthermore, when set RT_TIMER_SKIP_LIST_LEVEL to 1, it will just
    the same as the old double linked list, both in time and space
    complexity.
    
    Benchmarks shows that when RT_TIMER_SKIP_LIST_LEVEL is 3, the average
    time of random insertion of new timer is about 2 times faster than the
    old timer when there are 100 timers and 3 times faster when there are
    200 timers.
    
    However, it restores the deprecated funcion rt_system_timer_init. BSPs
    must invoke it upon system startup.

commit ca9b83c68fcc2b841400a5f4c7728a111582ffb7
Merge: 9193aca c9b8b74
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Oct 12 06:57:00 2013 -0700

    Merge pull request #172 from grissiom/rtt-next
    
    kernel: fix compiling error when RT_DEBUG is not defined

commit c9b8b7465fe17d80ad8850544944ef0d6fdaf7e8
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Oct 12 10:58:56 2013 +0800

    kernel: fix compiling error when RT_DEBUG is not defined
    
    Define RT_DEBUG_IN_THREAD_CONTEXT when RT_DEBUG is not defined.

commit 9193acafbfa3731e07dc2648628ca44a4c680dc5
Merge: 4eaadb7 6f71308
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Oct 11 08:36:47 2013 -0700

    Merge pull request #170 from grissiom/rtt-next
    
    kernel: add RT_DEBUG_IN_THREAD_CONTEXT

commit 6f71308ef529bfcecd54daaa309d1336ef0c6366
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Oct 11 22:46:05 2013 +0800

    kernel: add RT_DEBUG_IN_THREAD_CONTEXT
    
    In thread context means: 1) the scheduler has been started; 2) not in
    interrupt context. It is more stronger than RT_DEBUG_NOT_IN_INTERRUPT.
    With this commit, you will catch the error on situations like taking
    mutex before scheduling instead of crashing on NULL pointer reference.

commit 69bbd35f3821202947ae0eb8fef93652b28b13d0
Merge: 1ffb99e 5674198
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 9 08:33:02 2013 -0700

    Merge pull request #167 from grissiom/ymodem
    
    components/utilities: add ymodem

commit 5674198759e899854498207353ae59c526929070
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 9 20:27:00 2013 +0800

    components/utilities: add ymodem
    
    Real-YModem implemented a flexible YModem support. It use callback-based
    structure to let the user application to deal with the data. It contains
    3 examples:
    
        1. echo.c: write the data recieved on YModem to an other device
        2. null.c: discard the YModem data
        3. tofile.c: write the data to the file system
    
    Currently, it does not support batch file transmission.

commit 29871c0d84d4430302fc7a2c535a6fe8cda309cb
Merge: 1cb4ee7 7b0a3af
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Sep 22 21:07:20 2013 -0700

    Merge pull request #159 from grissiom/misc-fix
    
    kservice: export vsnprintf as rt_vsnprintf

commit 7b0a3afdf90e85cabe3e39f49a5c2aa22e3e3e8d
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 23 11:27:48 2013 +0800

    kservice: export vsnprintf as rt_vsnprintf
    
    vsnprintf is a common string function that could be used in many places.
    Using both vsnprintf in libc and vsnprintf in the RTT could make a
    bigger image. Moreover, if newlib is not enabled when compiling with
    GCC, referencing vsnprintf will lead to link error:
    
        .../arm-none-eabi/lib/armv7-ar/thumb/softfp/libc.a(lib_a-sbrkr.o):
        In function `_sbrk_r':
        sbrkr.c:(.text._sbrk_r+0xc): undefined reference to `_sbrk'
        collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
    
    Using rt_vsnprintf could avoid such problem.

commit 1cb4ee74fbc3243c7f938be348668bedf7e779cf
Merge: 7bdb082 6d2df9b
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Sep 22 15:23:56 2013 -0700

    Merge pull request #158 from grissiom/finsh-fix
    
    finsh: unregister rx_indicate when closing the device

commit 6d2df9bf9400acd6716a2a3c0b5c02f7973cc43c
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Sep 22 22:12:04 2013 +0800

    finsh: unregister rx_indicate when closing the device
    
    Because the device could still remain opened when closed by finsh, the
    old rx_indicate is useless for finsh. Some buggy driver will still
    generate rx_indicate even after the device has been closed. So FinSh
    should unregister the rx_indicate when releasing the old device.

commit c465bc2c2e837ad2d9ab9eb83f4aa138450ad16c
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Sep 14 13:12:23 2013 +0800

    rt_event_recv: add a check on the option flag
    
    Either RT_EVENT_FLAG_AND or RT_EVENT_FLAG_OR should be set in the option
    flag. If none of them is present, the waiting thread will never be
    resumed.

Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Sep 7 14:53:31 2013 +0800

    Scons: add a custom tool to do clang static analyze
    
    Bsps can use the clang analyzer as a tool:
    
        env = Environment(toolpath=[os.path.join(RTT_ROOT, 'tools',
                          'tools')], tools = ['clang-analyze'])
    
    When building the project, the static analyzer will be called to check
    all the C code. The warnings are print to stderr.

    finsh: use alias in the variable definition
    
    With this patch, one could define two alias for the same function like:
    
        FINSH_FUNCTION_EXPORT_ALIAS(rt_hw_cpu_reset, reboot, reboot the cpu);
        FINSH_FUNCTION_EXPORT_ALIAS(rt_hw_cpu_reset, __cmd_reboot, reboot the cpu);
    
    Suitable for being used in MSH/Finsh.

    rt_components_init.

    simulator: fix SDL initialization under Linux
    
    rt_hw_sdl_start should wait untill the rtgui_graphic_set_device is
    called int the sdl_loop. Use pthread_cond_wait to achieve this in Linux.

commit 246bdde8de4167065b4a52530a9c7be85c189dd8
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 22 16:43:06 2013 +0800

    dev/portal: fix bug in portal callback forwarding
    
    When forwarding rx/tx callback from the underlaying device(pipe), the
    "dev" argument should be the portal. So the portal callback could think
    itself as called.

commit 824261d3bc8467f6220061f43d22321f1ce50bc3
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 22 15:12:00 2013 +0800

    dev/portal: add checks on oflag
    
    It does not make sense to open portal without a flag. One should open a
    portal with RT_DEVICE_OFLAG_RDWR in most cases.

commit 6e676e7754e9042c333ff7f3826766c6462f92be
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>

    dev/portal: implement portal device
    
    Portal is a device that connect devices. Currently, you can only connect
    pipes in portal. Pipes are unidirectional. But with portal, you can
    construct a bidirectional device with two pipes.

commit 7e68096a88aaa9279507df54da191893be99f7df

    dev/pipe: make pipe a type of device
    
    Pipe have many differences with char device. The main difference is
    altough pipe have both read and write, it is unidirectional in nature.

commit 0340300f89a924b30fd8042b76686a236720d3d7
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>

    dev/pipe: cleanup

commit e8cca2315a790d61c743a71e1a682e6ace7866fd
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 15:57:59 2013 +0800

    dev/pipe: call rx_indicate the time we resume reader
    
    Some reader(FinSh again) would like to block on a semaphore which is
    released in rx_indicate. So we should invoke rx_indicate in
    _rt_pipe_resume_reader.

commit d683d32bd5502c15be600145966400a41710a7f4
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 15:35:56 2013 +0800

    device/pipe: add nonblocking read/write and force write mode
    
    The previous implementation will always blocks the reader/writer.
    However, at least FinSh would expect the device to be nonblocking ---
    read should return 0 when there is no data in it.

commit 4919d29d693491e8eae9697deed7b808c7bcbb93
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 11:52:04 2013 +0800

    ringbuffer: add put_force and putchar_force API
    
    Add the APIs that will discard the old data when rb is full.

commit 981d929b562610328309ee4e01d66727f5e6896e
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 10:50:20 2013 +0800

    ringbuffer: fix the ambiguous name
    
    RT_RINGBUFFER_SIZE could mean "the size of the whole buffer", "the size
    of the empty space" or "the size of the data". Moreover, it's never a
    micro anymore. Change it to rt_ringbuffer_data_len before it's too late.
    Also, RT_RINGBUFFER_EMPTY is changed to rt_ringbuffer_space_len.

commit 9980041de681134895573f0bd84ebe6ca8c07c41
Merge: f0f0e3d c3a3944
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Jul 14 21:01:40 2013 -0700

    Merge pull request #131 from grissiom/memheap
    
    memheap: don't alloc/memcpy when there is next node is enough for realloc

commit c3a39444daaa72c3c9b3e0001d0550cf56cca74d
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 15 11:29:58 2013 +0800

    memheap: dont alloc/memcpy when there is next node is enough for realloc
    
    When realloc a bigger space and the next node is free and big enough, we
    should directly relocate the next node instead of doing alloc/memcpy.
    The new method not only faster in this cases, it would avoid memory
    fragment as well.

    device: add ref_count support

Author: aozima <wuyangyong@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 9 21:40:20 2013 +0800

    enhancement hard fault exception handler.

commit 34027e65e3cd9844d2c001e4004ca63b61126a0f
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 9 19:55:14 2013 +0800

    building.py: add clang static analyzer support
    
    It adds the '--clang-analyzer' option that could invoke clang as the
    static code checker. It is recommanded to work with 'scan-build' shipped
    with Clang. For example, `scan-build scons --clang-analyzer`.

commit 7bcce9e87fa987d4bb88d48d3f7d0aca58963e74
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 9 11:54:50 2013 +0800

    device: add ref_count support
    
    This is a simple work around to the current device stack design. A
    ref_count could let different modules to open/close the same device
    independently without interfere others in some degree.
    
    But there is still some data shared between the modules, like flag,
    open_flag and user_data. Moreover, it won't yield an error if A open a
    device, and B read from it before open it in B. Maybe alloc a new handle
    in rt_device_open will be the ultimate solution. But that is much bigger
    change and we may leave it to future development.

commit 247772df3bc333f32d8372114a4337df29548cc1
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 26 10:10:26 2013 +0800

    add logtrace component
    
    Logtrace is a component that could output the log into either a device
    or a file. It has the ability to filter the log messages according to a
    pre-module level. Define RT_USING_LOGTRACE in rtconfig.h if you want to
    have a try.

commit bee9103eaf46754129981db00549b8b2419939b7
Merge: 3071e35 3ee4a18
Author: Bernard Xiong <bernard.xiong@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 19 03:15:29 2013 -0700

    Merge pull request #110 from grissiom/cscope
    
    tools: add an option to generate cscope database

commit 3ee4a1850635f7d36bbbc78eecbf15364ecb14e6
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 19 17:57:22 2013 +0800

    tools: add an option to generate cscope database
    
    When --cscope option is given to Scons, it will generate a cscope
    cross-reference database in current directory, which is useful in
    Vim(and other cscope-aware text editors). For example, `scons -s
    --cscope` will do nothing except generating the database. You can use
    this option with other options together.
    
    It is inspired by the `make cscope` of Linux.

commit e74befca44925f37a4fba93d6b16bd1c578c3e51

    move libcpu/arm/rm48x50/ to libcpu/arm/cortex-r4

commit 24fc6e6ebbb5769941845e4549382be6d6f76ced
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri May 31 20:25:44 2013 +0800

    rm48x50: VFP lazy stacking
    
    You need to turn on RT_VFP_LAZY_STACKING in rtconfig.h. By default, RTT
    will turn on VFP for all threads and stack all the VFP registers. When
    doing lazy stacking, VFP will only be turned on for the thread who
    issued VFP instructions.
    
    Currently, if a thread turned on VFP, it cannot be turned off. RTT will
    never know what time the thread doesn't need VFP any more. The thread
    might could turn off the VFP for it self in proper time.

commit 8bbfd45ce3bd78d01e8c03bd5877825f1bb4d610
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri May 31 18:38:42 2013 +0800

    rm48x50: change STMFD/LDMFD to STMDB/LDMIA
    
    VFP instructions only have IA(Increment After)/DB(Decrement Before)
    mode. To keep consistency, just change STM/LDM to DB/IA accordingly.

commit ec1203bfab2d8d518cb9991f57a4c8d30ec79dc9
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri May 31 18:32:21 2013 +0800

    rm48x50: turn on VFP support
    
    This support Common VFPv2 sub-architecture.

Merge: a33e992 624d947

commit f08df08897135d007715f4c27be41071f9d33b07
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun May 26 23:37:56 2013 +0800

    rm48x50: optimize a BEQ
    
    Use condition flag in the ORR. This could eliminate a BEQ.

commit 19fe6251e7085c39c69945aedde4c00b6167043b
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun May 26 22:37:49 2013 +0800

    rm48x50: optimize context_switch_interrupt_to by reuse registers
    
    When saving thread registers in context_switch_interrupt_to, we don't
    change them, just move them. So there is no need to always r0-r3 from
    stack to the real r0-r3. So just use the intermediate registers and
    eliminate 2 MOV.

commit a33e99272418b9570c10a2e82eab9fdb55596d3b
Merge: 2e25159 97a507e
Author: qiuyiuestc <qiuyiuestc@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat May 25 01:05:00 2013 -0700

    Merge pull request #95 from grissiom/vcom
    
    usbdevice/core: add reset function to support hotplug

commit 97a507e6673ca5e4c6e0d2bfa4fd38067292994d
Author: qiuyiuestc <qiuyiuestc@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat May 25 15:55:27 2013 +0800

    usbdevice/core: add reset function to support hotplug
    
    When the USB got RESET packet from the host and the address is setup,
    all the classes will got reset. The reset is done by class stop and than
    class run. So the classes should reset their internal state in
    class_{run,stop}.
    
    Besides, the USB device driver could post a USB_MSG_RESET message on
    every RESET packet.

commit 2e25159a837cd2b600db26fd313c80e01a064f9b

commit f51bce3fedcb5aa64514a4259068d85e8c534ab5
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri May 24 10:04:51 2013 +0800

    add rm48x50 bsp and libcpu
    
    We currently only support building with CCS and SCons is not using.
    bsp/rm48x50/HALCoGen/HALCoGen.{hcg,dil} is the HALCoGen project file.
    You may need to regenerate the source file as you like, providing that:
    
        1, IRQ is in Dispatch Mode and the table entry is IRQ_Handler. The
        channel 5 in enabled and connected to IRQ.
    
        2, RTI driver is enabled and compare3 source is selected to counter1
        and the compare3 will generate tick in the period of 10ms. This
        value is coresponding with RT_TICK_PER_SECOND in rtconfig.h.
    
    In CCS, you need to create a new CCS project and create link folders
    pointing at bsp/rm48x50, libcpu/arm/rm48x50 and src/, include/. Remember
    to add the include path to the Build Properties.

    usbdevice/core: use static message queue

    udev_msg, in order to keep backward compacity and for extention in the
    future, we set the size of message to 32.

commit f0d50a7b3634044b4bddad39fde01d474b5c6e9d
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun May 12 14:48:46 2013 +0800

    usbdevice/core: use static thread instead of dynamic thread
    
    It also add two configurations for the USB device even loop thread:
    
        RT_USBD_THREAD_STACK_SZ to set the stack size, default to 2048
        RT_USBD_THREAD_PRIO     to set the priority, default to 8
    
    You can overwrite the default values in rtconfig.h

commit aa179e44383a20234fd07f79805f571af9936a01
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat May 11 09:42:40 2013 +0800

    cdc_vcom: not to start sending data when the data is already sending
    
    We start the sending transaction in SOF handler. But if the data is
    already sending, start an other transaction will cause data lose.
    Implement a state machine is cdc_vcom and avoid that.

commit c24c4f8e16cfd1c1d6f2ecb9b74e37102975ea87
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Feb 24 23:29:27 2013 +0800

    building.py: append messed up objs list, use extend to avoid that
    
    The return type of SConscript is a subclass of UserList. We should use
    extend to keep the depth of the list is always 1 when concatenate
    SConscript return values. Thanks prife for making me realize that this
    is really a problem.
    
    Reported-and-Tested-by: prife

commit 278cc914b3ba76a0c7a6b46d23f0f1bbc7491331

    more deterministic on timer
    
    If two timer will timeout at the same tick, the one started later will
    be called later. I've tested the patch on simulator and it _seems_ OK.
    
    Reported-by: xdzy on the forum and delin17 <delin17@qq.com>

commit 9168e18e5cb9589e79752f04b3da911fb9758bf0
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Jan 13 09:48:37 2013 +0800

    newlib: use the LIBS argument in DefineGroup instead of modifying the Env

commit 8ad12057c43b2f08be4578b51f8990296646706a
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 11 15:13:11 2013 +0800

    Newlib: link with libm in default.
    
    libm is a frequently used lib. Newlib is compiled with
    -ffunction-sections in recent GCC tool chains. The linker would just
    link in the functions that have been referenced. So setting this won't
    result in bigger text size.

commit 3ef523714f9e69771b5288c4c922218edbed2a36
Author: Grissiom <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 10 14:58:07 2013 +0800

    remove math code for newlib
    
    Newlib already have optimized and full featured math implementation. To
    use it, one should add:
    
        env['LIBS'] = ['m']
    
    or equivalent to the SConstruct.

commit 66c5a05e6273ee8396d738373c526230dbc4a600
Author: chaos.proton@gmail.com <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 15 13:16:35 2012 +0000

    building.py: add RegisterPreBuildingAction
    
    One could register a callable object(normally a function) via RegisterPreBuildingAction in SConscript. It will be called when PreBuilding get invoked. PreBuilding should be called before the building procedure. It is currently used by RTGUI to generate the minimal perfect hash code when all the source files are scanned(i.e. just before building).
    
    Maybe we should invoke PreBuilding in DoBuilding.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2353 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

commit 8cf479caaa7a5840b926245e13e96f789180d758
Author: chaos.proton@gmail.com <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Jul 22 11:17:04 2012 +0000

    add "remove_components" feature
    
    If one do not want to use some components in the RTT_ROOT, it can pass a remove_components=['the_component'] parameter to PrepareBuilding. Sample code is:
    
    RTT_RTGUI = os.getenv('RTT_RTGUI')
    # if GUI dir is set to other place, don't use the one in RTT_ROOT
    if RTT_RTGUI:
        # prepare building environment
        objs = PrepareBuilding(env, RTT_ROOT, has_libcpu=False, remove_components=['rtgui'])
        objs += SConscript(os.path.join(RTT_RTGUI, 'SConscript'))
    else:
        objs = PrepareBuilding(env, RTT_ROOT, has_libcpu=False)
    
    You can safely omit the parameter if you do not want to remove any components.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2227 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

commit 0b1f74870105bf32277a7d40e9a9b4919a43826c

    See http://docs.python.org/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.remove for detail.

    overlapFunc will return RTGUI_REGION_STATUS_FAILURE in some
    circumstance(OOM etc), check it and return error if any thing goes
    wrong. It prevents garbage values crashing the system.
    
    Please ignore the eol diff noise.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1802 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1794 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

commit 22a9d6f309f1714c36ca68ee584589d559604e57
Author: chaos.proton@gmail.com <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 16 03:12:04 2011 +0000

    revert commit 1791
    
    That commit broke bsp/stm3210x. The cause is that we calls rtgui_system_init in rtgui_startup. But the calibration starts before rtgui_startup and rtgui_system_init. This lead to crash.
    
    One way to deal with it is move rtgui_system_init out of rtgui_startup and call it manually. But it will affect other bsps. So just revert the "bad" commit.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1793 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

commit 4e8d6639f001bcf3939bfe8012943f287289d287
Author: chaos.proton@gmail.com <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 8 09:33:18 2011 +0000

    bsp/stm32f10x: calibrate touch screen before starting GUI
    
    If we do not calibrate the touch screen, GUI is unusable. This patch use a semaphore to block GUI thread until calibration finish.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1791 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

commit 93104fb4fc4361d75a3249a804a904db0d54a72a
Author: chaos.proton@gmail.com <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 8 07:52:20 2011 +0000

    bsp/stm32f10x/touch: return early when lost the position
    
    Check whether finger is still on the screen. If not, we couldn't determine where the user has touched. It's better to return early rather than give garbage values.
    
    A more sensitive solution might be caculate the position once the interrupt occured. But it's not anti-shake friendly.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1789 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

commit e803640027323b9bacc29bf3d11ee83f4464bd0b
Author: chaos.proton@gmail.com <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 2 08:58:34 2011 +0000

    avoid divided by zero error
    
    The old code only checks touch->max_x > touch->min_x but not touch->max_x == touch->min_x. Thus may lead to divided by zero error.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

commit 9de3512c8a463d188baaa48570a0cc4277251726
Author: chaos.proton@gmail.com <chaos.proton@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 2 08:17:40 2011 +0000

    fix ads7843 data fetching
    
    The old code forgot to drop the MSB in the very first byte retrieved from ads7843 after a control byte. This will lead to data corruption especially in 16-Clocks per conversion mode.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1781 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

    *** EFM32 branch ***
    1. Add interrupt context check function (context_gcc.S)

commit 30d072eee8c9bc9be8651e528fcef874dd039ca1
Author: onelife.real <onelife.real@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 11 06:16:26 2011 +0000

    *** EFM32 branch ***
    1. Solve the problem mentioned in revision 1623 (runtime error)
       - Cause: In the EFM32 demo application, some TCP/IP functions are called in non-task context (e.g. "tcp_new()"). And after revision 1621, those functions will trigger the scheduler ("rt_schedule()") which seems to be triggered only in task context.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1624 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

commit 2156e22b3c74cd60d7500e8e4224cb63cab168a5

Date:   Fri Jul 8 08:24:33 2011 +0000

    *** EFM32 branch ***
    1. Remove "RT_USING_NETUTILS" defined in "rtconfig.h" to avoid compiling error
       - Warning: Due to the memory limitation, running lwIP on Gecko devices (EFM32G) is not properly tested.
       - Warning: To test lwIP, please revert the file, "components\net\lwip\src\arch\sys_arch.c", to revision 1620. There is a runtime error when working with the latest revision of that file. This error is currently under evaluation.
    
    git-svn-id: https://rt-thread.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1623 bbd45198-f89e-11dd-88c7-29a3b14d5316

Date:   Mon Jun 20 01:56:28 2011 +0000

    *** EFM32 branch ***
    1. Add SD card driver (SPI mode)
    2. Add ELM ChaN FatFs support (Please read "Readme.txt")
       - Warning: FatFs is really FAT! (35KB)
    3. Upgrade EFM32 libraries (CMSIS and efm32lib) to version 2.0.0
    4. Merge all of the C source code in "libcpu\arm\cortex-m3\" into "cpuport.c"
    5. Merge all of the assembly source code in "libcpu\arm\cortex-m3\" into "context_gcc.S" (except "start_gcc.S")
